result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To pay the costs of the action. 60 days to pay costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.
Consecutive to 14-CF-79. Credit for time served.  If sentence currently being served ends up being a time served sentence, defendant may be entitled to additional 49 days credit.

records.addlTxt: Minute sheet. Defense waives reading of the Information. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 2. Court dismisses Ct. 1 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defense must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Atty Schaefer asks court to set off sentencing until 3/10/16 when defendant will be in court for sentencing on another file. Bond remains in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Todd A Smith in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Todd A Smith in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
